class.name: Word.ListItem
class.description: Represents the paragraph list item format.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a ListItem object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application before performing list operations.

properties.name: level
properties.description: Specifies the level of the item in the list.

examples.description: Set the list level of a newly inserted list item to level 5 (index 4) at the end of a list.

properties.name: listString
properties.description: Gets the list item bullet, number, or picture as a string.

examples.description: Get and display the list item string (bullet, number, or picture) from the first paragraph in the document that is part of a list.

properties.name: siblingIndex
properties.description: Gets the list item order number in relation to its siblings.

examples.description: Get and display the position of the current paragraph within its sibling list items (e.g., whether it's the 1st, 2nd, or 3rd item at the same level).

methods.name: getAncestor
methods.description: Gets the list item parent, or the closest ancestor if the parent doesn't exist. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the list item has no ancestor.

params.name: parentOnly
params.description: Optional. Specifies only the list item's parent will be returned. The default is false that specifies to get the lowest ancestor.

examples.description: Get the parent list item of the currently selected list item and highlight it in yellow

methods.name: getAncestorOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the list item parent, or the closest ancestor if the parent doesn't exist. If the list item has no ancestor, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties.

params.name: parentOnly
params.description: Optional. Specifies only the list item's parent will be returned. The default is false that specifies to get the lowest ancestor.

examples.description: Get the parent list item of the currently selected paragraph and display its text, or show a message if no parent exists

methods.name: getDescendants
methods.description: Gets all descendant list items of the list item.

params.name: directChildrenOnly
params.description: Optional. Specifies only the list item's direct children will be returned. The default is false that indicates to get all descendant items.

examples.description: Get all nested list items under the first list item in the document and highlight them in yellow

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Get and display the list level of the first paragraph in the document if it's a list item

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Configure multiple list item properties at once by setting the level to 1 and list type to bullets for the first paragraph

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ListItem object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ListItemData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the list item properties as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console for debugging purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member. If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a list item object across multiple sync calls to safely modify its properties without getting an "InvalidObjectPath" error

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member. Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get list item information from the first paragraph and then untrack the list item object to free memory after use.
